author: Special Correspondent
text:
College girls received orientation on ‘Women-Related Laws’ from none other than women judges of Erode courts recently.

During the two-day Legal Awareness Programme at Nandha Engineering College, organised by the Department of Computer Science and Engineering in association with National Commission for Women, T. Malar Valantina, Chief Judicial Magistrate, and G. Bhuvaneshwari, First Additional Sub-Judge, prepared the minds of students to face possible problems in family life ahead.

While there are several laws providing succour to women affected by inimical family situations, there was a need for awareness about evading such situations, Ms. Valantina said.

Irrespective of the positions women hold, the patriarchal society has an easy way of destroying a woman's dignity by casting aspersions on character. Women, in such situations, ought to courageously prove their standing well amidst men, rather than keeping away, Ms. Bhuvaneshwari said.

V. Shanmugan, Chairman, Sri Nandha Educational Trust, also addressed the students.

Expert sessions

There were altogether six expert sessions, three each on two days, based on a manual prepared by the National Commission for Women.

The programme culminated with valedictory address by G.P. Elango, Principal District and Sessions Judge, who is also the Chairman of District Legal Service Authority, Erode.
title: Students sensitised on women-related laws
